intro: Calystegia malacophylla subsp. tomentella, commonly known as the woolly morning glory, is a flowering plant belonging to the Convolvulaceae family. It is characterized by its hairy, creeping stems and heart-shaped leaves covered in a dense layer of fine, white pubescence. The flowers are typically pale blue or lavender, with five petals and a distinctive spurred structure. This subspecies is native to parts of southern Africa and is often found in rocky or disturbed habitats. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
